                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>"RivTemp is a partnership between universities, federal and provincial agencies, watershed organizations and Atlantic salmon conservation organizations.
RivTemp aims to bring together organizations concerned with water temperature issues in Atlantic salmon rivers; to centralize temperature data collected by different organizations on a variety of rivers in Eastern Canada (RivTemp database) and to develop thermal metrics relevant to the development of salmon protection tools and protocols. 
The establishment of the RivTemp network and its database was made possible by the financial contribution of the Atlantic Salmon Conservation Foundation (ASCF) and the participation of numerous partners active in the salmon river thermal monitoring program.
For more information visit http://rivtemp.ca/"</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

            <gmd:resourceConstraints>
                <gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>
                    
                    <gmd:useLimitation>
                        <gco:CharacterString>https://opendatacommons.org/licenses/by/1-0/</gco:CharacterString>
                    </gmd:useLimitation>
                    
                    
                    <gmd:useLimitation>
                        <gco:CharacterString>"The RivTemp database is the result of a joint effort by RivTemp network partners to share river water temperature data. The database cannot be transferred, in part or in whole, to any other organization.
You are free to use, develop, and produce works from the data as long as you assign any public use of the data, or works produced from the data, as specified in the license.You must clearly indicate the source of the data (DatasetName) when using the data contained in the RivTemp database and not modify any notice of the original data. The citation must include at least:   
1) 'RivTemp'  and    
2) The partners responsible for the stations identify in 'Dataset Name'. 
RivTemp and its partners assume no liability for any actions, errors or omissions, use, misuse or results arising from the use of all or part of its data."</gco:CharacterString>
                    </gmd:useLimitation>
                    
                </gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>
            </gmd:resourceConstraints>

            </gmd:language>

                <gmd:MD_TopicCategoryCode>inlandWaters</gmd:MD_TopicCategoryCode>
            </gmd:topicCategory>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-4vph-rb61
notes:
"RivTemp is a partnership between universities, federal and provincial agencies, watershed organizations and Atlantic salmon conservation organizations.
RivTemp aims to bring together organizations concerned with water temperature issues in Atlantic salmon rivers; to centralize temperature data collected by different organizations on a variety of rivers in Eastern Canada (RivTemp database) and to develop thermal metrics relevant to the development of salmon protection tools and protocols. 
The establishment of the RivTemp network and its database was made possible by the financial contribution of the Atlantic Salmon Conservation Foundation (ASCF) and the participation of numerous partners active in the salmon river thermal monitoring program.
For more information visit http://rivtemp.ca/"

notes_translated.en:
"RivTemp is a partnership between universities, federal and provincial agencies, watershed organizations and Atlantic salmon conservation organizations.
RivTemp aims to bring together organizations concerned with water temperature issues in Atlantic salmon rivers; to centralize temperature data collected by different organizations on a variety of rivers in Eastern Canada (RivTemp database) and to develop thermal metrics relevant to the development of salmon protection tools and protocols. 
The establishment of the RivTemp network and its database was made possible by the financial contribution of the Atlantic Salmon Conservation Foundation (ASCF) and the participation of numerous partners active in the salmon river thermal monitoring program.
For more information visit http://rivtemp.ca/"
notes_translated.fr:
« RivTemp est un partenariat entre des universités, des agences fédérales et provinciales, des organisations de bassin versant et des organisations de conservation du saumon de l'Atlantique.
RivTemp vise à rassembler les organisations concernées par les problèmes de température de l'eau dans les rivières à saumon de l'Atlantique ; à centraliser les données de température collectées par différentes organisations sur diverses rivières de l'est du Canada (base de données RivTemp) et à développer des mesures thermiques pertinentes pour le développement d'outils et de protocoles de protection du saumon. 
La mise en place du réseau RivTemp et de sa base de données a été rendue possible grâce à la contribution financière de l'Atlantic Salmon Conservation Foundation (ASCF) et à la participation de nombreux partenaires actifs dans le programme de surveillance thermique des rivières à saumon.
Pour plus d'informations, rendez-vous sur http://rivtemp.ca/ »

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
